Interaction.Title: Advantages of a National Monitoring Protocol

Step.name: Advantages of a National Monitoring Protocol
Step.html: Why go to all the effort to have a standardized forest monitoring protocol? There are several reasons, but chief among them are communicating with co-workers, line-officers and the public.

Step.name: Communicating with Co-workers
Step.html: A common protocol improves our ability to communicate information to our co-workers since everyone is reporting and describing soil visual classes similarly. In addition, information can be shared between soil scientists on different ranger districts and forests.

Step.name: Communicating with Line-Officers
Step.html: Frequently soil scientists are asked to provide line-officers a report on the effect of different management activities on the soil resource. The statistically-based protocol that uses soil-based visual indicators can be easily understood by all.

Step.name: Communicating with the Public
Step.html: By using the FSDMP consistently we can show the public that we are maintaining forest productivity after harvest activities and that we have the data to back up the claims.
